formulations.name: Saraswatarishta
formulations.preparation: Fermented decoction with herbs and jaggery

formulations.name: Kutajarishta
formulations.preparation: Fermented decoction with Kutaja bark and jaggery

formulations.name: Dashmularishta
formulations.preparation: Fermented liquid (asava / arishta): decoction of herbs + powder + sugar / jaggery, allow fermentation, filter, bottle

formulations.name: Khadirarishta

ingredients.herb: 13 other herbs (detailed list not fully given)

formulations.adultDosage: 3 teaspoons twice daily with equal amount of lukewarm water
formulations.modeOfAction: Acts on skin, urinary, and cardiovascular systems.
formulations.generalConsiderations: The Asava / Arishta class is self-preserving via its alcohol content; ideal use within about one year of purchase.

formulations.name: Arvindasav
formulations.adultDosage: 2 teaspoons twice daily after a meal with equal amount of water

formulations.name: Kumaryasava
formulations.preparation: Decoction of herbs is prepared and cooled; mixed with aloe juice and jaggery (as sugar source) and allowed to ferment naturally for defined period (7–21 days) until desired alcoholic strength; filter and bottle.
formulations.reference: Ayurvedic Formulary citations (PlanetAyurveda summary), 1mg / product monographs

formulations.name: Mahasudarshan Kāḍa

ingredients.herb: Pippali, Maricha, other supportive herbs (Piper longum / Piper nigrum)

formulations.generalConsiderations: Use per physician in pregnant women. Some formulas may be strong for children; adjust dose.
formulations.preparation: Boil herbs in water (e.g., 400 ml for 10 g total herbs) reduce to 1/4 volume, filter — serve warm. For concentrated use, reduce further per classical instruction.

formulations.name: Trikuta Kṣīrapāka
formulations.modeOfAction: Milk-based decoction to moderate the hot/pungent action of Trikatu.
formulations.generalConsiderations: Used when digestion support is needed with a milk basis, to calm irritative effect in some patients.

formulations.name: Yava Kshara
formulations.adultDosage: 125-500 mg twice a day before meals (or per physician)
formulations.modeOfAction: Classical herbomineral alkali for urinary system.
formulations.generalConsiderations: Use with strict supervision. Use with strict supervision; especially in bleeding / sensitive conditions

formulations.name: Panchamrit Parpati
formulations.adultDosage: 1-2 tablets with milk or lukewarm water 2-3 times a day (or per practitioner)
formulations.modeOfAction: Classical herbo-mineral formulation for digestive and hematopoietic systems.
formulations.generalConsiderations: High risk if misused; must be taken under expert supervision. High risk if misused; must be taken under expert supervision

formulations.name: Trikatu Syrup
indications: Helps with gas, bloating, indigestion, flatulence
formulations.adultDosage: ~5 ml twice a day (or 1 teaspoon twice daily in many syrup / liquid versions)
formulations.modeOfAction: Stimulates digestive enzymes and improves metabolism.
formulations.generalConsiderations: Classical Trikatu combination in syrup form.

formulations.name: Punarnavadi Mandoor

dosage.frequency: Once or twice daily before or after food

formulations.reference: Charak Samhita Chikitsa Sthana 16/93-95, Bhaishajya Ratnavali

dosage.duration: before or after food or as directed by physician

formulations.name: Panchkola Capsules
indications: Stimulates liver/pancreas/intestines to secrete digestive juices
Used in digestive, detox / metabolic disorders
